Package src.tictactoe.util

Class ArrayHandler

java.lang.Object
src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
public class ArrayHandler
extends java.lang.Object
ArrayHandler class contains methods to inspect a 2D-array from every direction. checkForWin method of this class goes through each method that inspects the array for amount of marks required to win.
Author:
Mika Kivennen√§

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ArrayHandler()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean checkColumns​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired)
    checkColumns method goes through each column to see if pc or player has won the game Goes through each column from top to bottom counting the given marks to check if there's enough of them in a row to make this return as true.
    boolean checkDiagonalLines​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired)
    checkDiagonalLines method goes through diagonal lines The method goes through each diagonal line starting from top left going to bottom right Then it goes through diagonal lines from bottom left to top right
    boolean checkForDraw​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck)
    checkForDraw Method goes through each square to see if there isn't any empty squares after player have taken their turns.
    boolean checkForWin​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired, boolean gameOver)
    checkForWin uses different methods to see if there's a winner in the game Uses different methods in this class that go through the given array in multiple ways.
    boolean checkRows​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired)
    checkRows method goes through each row to see if pc or player has won the game Goes through each row from left to right counting the given marks to check if there's enough of them in a row to make this return as true.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public ArrayHandler()

  • Method Details

    • checkForWin

      public boolean checkForWin​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired, boolean gameOver)
      checkForWin uses different methods to see if there's a winner in the game Uses different methods in this class that go through the given array in multiple ways. Returns a boolean value on if there's required amount of marks in a row.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected.
      markToCheck - this is the mark that is being looked for in the array.
      amountRequired - this is the integer value needed to win.
      gameOver - this is a boolean that is used to reset gameWon boolean after each game.
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value if the mark that is being checked wins or not.

    • checkForDraw

      public boolean checkForDraw​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck)
      checkForDraw Method goes through each square to see if there isn't any empty squares after player have taken their turns. If there aren't any empty spaces in the array then this will return as true.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      markToCheck - this is the mark that is being looked for in the array.
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value if the game is draw or not

    • checkRows

      public boolean checkRows​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired)
      checkRows method goes through each row to see if pc or player has won the game Goes through each row from left to right counting the given marks to check if there's enough of them in a row to make this return as true.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      markToCheck - this is the mark that is being looked for in the array.
      amountRequired - this is the integer value needed to win
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value if the mark that is being checked wins or not.

    • checkColumns

      public boolean checkColumns​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired)
      checkColumns method goes through each column to see if pc or player has won the game Goes through each column from top to bottom counting the given marks to check if there's enough of them in a row to make this return as true.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      markToCheck - this is the mark that is being looked for in the array.
      amountRequired - this is the integer value needed to win
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value if the mark that is being checked wins or not.

    • checkDiagonalLines

      public boolean checkDiagonalLines​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String markToCheck, int amountRequired)
      checkDiagonalLines method goes through diagonal lines The method goes through each diagonal line starting from top left going to bottom right Then it goes through diagonal lines from bottom left to top right
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      markToCheck - this is the mark that is being looked for in the array.
      amountRequired - this is the integer value needed to win
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value if the mark that is being checked wins or not.
